Test Description: 2 iperf client pods, 2 iperf server pods, Shutdown switch ineterface used by one of client pod.
Expected Behaviour: Only one switch interface must be used by both client pods. And Network bandwidth should drop by 50%.
Notes / Detailed Description:
BW dropped to 50% when one of the network links used by the client pods was shut down.
When the port was opened the BW got back to 100%
single link restart : 2 combinations
1 - shut/no shut with 2-3 second interval
2-  shut/no shut with 30 second interval

Test Description: 2 iperf client pods, 2 iperf server pods, Shutdown & restart switch ineterface used by one of client pod."
Expected Behaviour: One must be able to get expected bandwidth.
Notes / Detailed Description: The interface was shut and opened within an interval of 3-4 seconds. There was no major drop/change in the bandwidth.

Test Description: 2 iperf client pods, 2 iperf server pods, Shutdown switch ineterface used by one of server pod.
Expected Behaviour: Only one switch interface must be used by both server pods.Must see network bandwidth drop by 50%
Notes / Detailed Description:
BW dropped to 50% when one of the network links used by the server pods was shut down.
When the port was opened the BW got back to 100%

Test Description: 2 iperf client pods, 2 iperf server pods, Shutdown & restart switch ineterface used by one of server pod.
Expected Behaviour: Must get expected bandwidth as both links are up.
Notes / Detailed Description: The interface was shut and opened within an interval of 3-4 seconds. There was no major drop/change in the bandwidth.

Test Description: 2 iperf client pods, 2 iperf server pods, Shutdown switch ineterfaces used by both of client pods.
Notes / Detailed Description: The bandwidth dropped down to 0 when both the network ports used by the client pods were shut down.

Test Description: 2 iperf client pods, 2 iperf server pods, Shutdown switch ineterfaces used by both of server pods.
Notes / Detailed Description: The bandwidth dropped down to 0 when both the network ports used by the server pods were shut down.

Test Description: Run bi-di traffic and do continues link flap (both network ports)
Notes / Detailed Description: All pods were in running state after the link flap was stopped.

Test Description: Run bi-di traffic and do continues link flap (one network port)
Notes / Detailed Description: Flapped one nw link on all the nodes for 60 iterations. The cluster status was healthy after the link flap was done and all the iperf pods were running.

Test Description: 1 pod, 1 volume, shutdown switch interface used by initiator.
Notes / Detailed Description:
Got expected iops with one storage link down on the initiator.
If both the storage links are turned down, the pod goes into CrashLoopbackOff state and the IOPS drop down to 0.

Test Description: 1 pod, 1 volume, shutdown switch interface used by target.
Notes / Detailed Description:
Got expected iops with one storage link down on the target.
If both the storage links are turned down, the pod goes into CrashLoopbackOff state and the iops drop down to 0.

Test Description: 2 pods, 2 volumes, Link pull test
Expected Behaviour: Must see drop in iops by 50%. After making interface up, must get expected iops.
Notes / Detailed Description: This TC is not applicable for remote testing. Needs to be performed on site.

Test Description: 2 pods, 2 volumes, shutdown switch interface used by one of initiator.
Expected Behaviour: Must get 50% less IOPS than whatever we getting before shuting switch interface down.
Notes / Detailed Description: Same as expected
Note: For all of these test cases, the expected behaviour is seen only for read only or write only pods. In case of RW pods the iops did not drop to 50%. The IOPS we were getting was >=200K.

Test Description: 2 pods, 2 volumes, shutdown & restart switch interface used by one of initiator.
Expected Behaviour: After shuting down switch interface, must see drop in iops by 50%. After making interface up, must get expected iops.
Notes / Detailed Description: Same as expected

Test Description: 2 pods, 2 volumes, shutdown switch interface used by one of target.
Notes / Detailed Description: Same as expected

Test Description: 2 pods, 2 volumes, shutdown & restart switch interface used by one of target.
Expected Behaviour: After shuting down switch interface, must see drop in iops by 50%. After making interface up, must get expected iops.
Notes / Detailed Description: Same as expected

Test Description: 2 pods, 2 volumes, shutdown switch inetrfaces used by both initiator.
Bug no:
DWS-4945
Comment by Naveen: This is expected behavior today. When both the links are brought down, the Remote Storage Pods (single plex) will start failing. And we don't have an auto-recovery mechanism in this case.
Expected Behaviour: Must get 0 IOPs. Intiator and target side cleanup is done correctly.
Notes / Detailed Description: BW dropped down to 0, pods went into crashLoopbackOff state. They didnt go back to normal after the interfaces were turned up. Volumes were in attached state all the while.

Test Description: 2 pods, 2 volumes, shutdown switch inetrfaces used by both targets.
Bug no:
DWS-4945
Comment by Naveen: This is expected behavior today. When both the links are brought down, the Remote Storage Pods (single plex) will start failing. And we don't have an auto-recovery mechanism in this case.
Expected Behaviour: Must get 0 IOPs. Intiator and target side cleanup is done correctly.
Notes / Detailed Description: BW dropped down to 0, pods went into crashLoopbackOff state. They didnt go back to normal after the interfaces were turned up. Volumes were in attached state all the while.

Test Description: Stress test with continues link flap
Notes / Detailed Description:
started a stress test with the specfile "cfg-stress-storage-only.json" and the link flap has been started for a single storage port on each of the nodes. (if both the storage ports are shut, the pod goes into CrashLoopbckOff state)
The stress test ran for 5 iterations and failed in the 6th as 6 out of 192 fio pods didnt go in Running state. However when checked volumes and pods and cluster status, all the pods were Running and volumes attached. The cluster status was healthy. Increasing the runtime in podauto would have sorted the problem as fio pods take longer to go into Running state.

Test Description: Stress test (bi-di fio traffic) with continues link flap (flap both storage ports)
Expected Behaviour: Check pods status, io failure message

Test Description: Stress test (bi-di fio traffic) with continues link flap (flap single storage ports)
Expected Behaviour: Check pods status, io failure message
Notes / Detailed Description:
Ran 24 fio bi-di pods. The podauto got stuck in the 3rd iteration while deleting one of the pods.
The pod was stuck in terminating state. However the cluster status was good. The rest of the pods were in Running state and the respective volumes were attached.

Test Description: Stress test (bi-di fio traffic) with continues link flap (flap both storage ports)
Notes / Detailed Description:
failed in the second iteration. 
all the pods and volumes stuck in pending
nvmeoe core crashed on appserv71 and the NODE status was failed.

Test Description: Stress test (bi-di fio traffic) with continues link flap (flap single storage port)
Notes / Detailed Description: 34 iterations passed

Test Description: Flap only one storage link of initiator node.
Flap only one storage link of target node.
